education.institution: Boston University Questrom School of Business

personality.decision_making_approach: Data‑driven with stakeholder input; prefers structured analysis before committing
personality.risk_tolerance: Moderate – comfortable with calculated financial risks but avoids speculative bets
personality.collaboration_style: Structured, clear roles and responsibilities; values documented decisions
personality.stress_management_approach: Runs 3×/week, short mindfulness sessions, blocks calendar for micro‑breaks
personality.conflict_resolution_style: Collaborative – seeks win‑win outcomes, uses facts to de‑escalate

availability.travel_flexibility: Moderate – up to 25 % travel (≈5 days per quarter) for client/partner workshops

personal_factors.caregiving_responsibilities: Morning school drop‑off, occasional evening care
personal_factors.career_motivation: Goal to become Director of Finance; passionate about data‑driven strategic decision‑making

collaboration.meeting_frequency_preference: Bi‑weekly team sync + ad‑hoc as needed; ≤4 hrs/week total meeting time
collaboration.feedback_style: Direct but constructive; prefers specific examples
collaboration.knowledge_sharing_habits: Maintains shared Confluence docs; runs monthly brown‑bag finance analytics session

risk_factors.potential_bottlenecks: Quarter‑end forecasting heavily reliant on her models; absence could delay reporting
burnout_risk_factors: High workload during fiscal close periods
Limited personal time in Q4 due to bonus planning
